<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/discovery-launches-food-network-kitchen-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Discovery Makes Streamed Dumplings
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Discovery Makes Streamed Dumplings" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNzc1OTc3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you were to take a dozen hot business trends, mix in a dash of celebrity, and drizzle with smart home technology, you'd get Food Network Kitchen, a direct-to-consumer streaming service Discovery, Inc. <a href="https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/discoverys-food-network-kitchen-subscription-service-launches-in-u-s-with-live-cooking-classes-1203378710/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a> in the U.S. yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But calling this a streaming service is like calling the iPhone a calculator. Food Network Kitchen offers subscribers a library of old cooking shows (like <em>Barefoot Contessa</em>), recipe guides/videos—and food delivery is on the way. But there's a star of the show...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The Peloton for cooking</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Food Network Kitchen features live and on-demand cooking classes taught by celebrity chefs like Guy Fieri, Bobby Flay, and Martha Stewart. It's <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/discovery-and-amazon-serve-up-new-cooking-app-11569423600?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">modeled</a> after Peloton's popular spin classes, with one crucial difference: You can alert the instructor before you throw up. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Viewers will be able to comment on chefs' questionable uses of papaya through the show's interactive format.  </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The service will offer 25 live classes per week plus thousands of other instructional videos.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Big picture</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Food Network Kitchen offers a <a href="https://digiday.com/media/discovery-will-use-food-network-kitchen-generate-commerce-revenue-old-tv-shows/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">window</a> into how legacy cable companies are aiming to stay alive as Big Tech, Big Telecom, and Big Mouse invade the video streaming space. Here's Discovery's playbook... <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Get niche: </strong></span><span>After launching this cooking vertical, Discovery also plans to establish streaming services for natural history programming and home improvement (the latter led by Chip and Joanna Gaines). </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Diversify revenue: </strong></span><span>Food Network Kitchen will make money through advertising, subscriptions, and affiliate commerce. An ideal customer journey goes something like: "watch show → be intrigued by recipe → buy ingredients → become loyal paying subscriber." </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Leverage technology: </strong></span><span>Discovery has inked a </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/10/22/food-network-kitchen-brings-live-interactive-cooking-classes-to-echo-show-fire-tv-more/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">partnership with Amazon</a></span><span> to integrate the service with Amazon's smart devices like the Alexa-enabled Echo and Echo Show. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Discovery remains an underdog in the streaming wars, but it thinks being your go-to sous chef is a good place to start.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PHARMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/biogen-shocks-medical-community-reversal-alzheimers-drug?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Biogenerating Hope for Alzheimer's Patients
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2019, we repurpose plastic, cans, clothes—and Alzheimer's drugs. Yesterday, Biogen shocked the medical community by <a href="http://investors.biogen.com/news-releases/news-release-details/biogen-plans-regulatory-filing-aducanumab-alzheimers-disease?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announcing</a> it’s bringing back aducanumab, an Alzheimer’s drug it shelved earlier this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> Current treatments for Alzheimer's, the most common cause of dementia, <a href="https://apnews.com/d8b2c2fa679d40ae97837ec7840e6a64?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">only ease</a> symptoms temporarily. They don't slow memory loss or deterioration of thinking skills. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In one of Biogen's studies, patients given a high dose of aducanumab showed 23% less decline on one measure of cognitive ability compared with patients given a placebo. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The reversal: </strong>In March, a "futility analysis" <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/c48e12b2-f4bc-11e9-a79c-bc9acae3b654?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">deemed</a> the drug a no-go. But Biogen looked at some new data with fresh eyes and determined it's ready for action. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This could be as big a medical game-changer as Alexander Fleming's moldy petri dishes. Alzheimer's affects about 5.7 million people in the U.S. and about 50 million globally. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The announcement was definitely a year-changer for Biogen shares. They </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/22/biogen-soars-40percent-on-hopes-of-alzheimers-treatment-approval.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">erased</a></span><span> a 25% year-to-date drop in just one day. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Biogen said it will file for FDA approval in early 2020.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/whats-causing-global-protests?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Citizens Doth Protest Inequality, Corruption
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="The Citizens Doth Protest Inequality, Corruption" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNzc4MTQ1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Marcelo Hernandez/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">People across the globe are pulling on their marching shoes. The protests’ geographic coordinates are very different, but the complaints are not. Over the last several weeks...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In Lebanon</strong></span><span>, a tax on WhatsApp calls </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/18/frustrated-lebanese-take-streets?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sent frustrations</a></span><span> with the cost of living to a boiling point.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In Ecuador</strong></span><span>, the government </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2019/10/14/770104729/ecuador-reaches-fuel-subsidy-deal-to-end-violent-protests?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">had to walk back</a></span><span> a fuel price hike to quell violent protests. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In Chile</strong></span><span>, a transit fare hike </span><span><a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/10/chile-protests-prompted-unrest-191022160029869.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">had a similar effect</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In Haiti</strong></span><span>, inflation and </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-50023443?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fuel shortages</a></span><span> are driving up prices. Protests have been raging for weeks. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In the Spanish region of Catalonia</strong></span><span>, violent protests </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-50064106?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">grounded in</a></span><span> a decades-old separatist movement and resentment over taxation sprang up again after Catalan independence leaders were sentenced. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In Bolivia and the U.K.</strong>, grievances are more political—they’re focused on an <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-global-protests/season-of-discontent-protests-flare-around-the-world-idUSKBN1X127J?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">allegedly stolen</a> election and <a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2019/10/thousands-descend-london-streets-protest-brexit-191019120732687.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brexit</a>, respectively. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Plus, Hong Kong’s pro-democracy movement is on </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-49317695?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">month five</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Almost all of these demonstrations target a) economic inequality or b) government corruption. Residents of many countries feel the average citizen isn’t getting a fair shot—and they blame those in control.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>+ Chart for the road from </em><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-50123494?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>the BBC</em></a>...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1571786349.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>The BBC</em></sup></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
APPAREL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/kevin-plank-will-step-ceo-armour?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
23 Years Is a Long Time to Hold a Plank
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="23 Years Is a Long Time to Hold a Plank" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNzc4NDIyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><div>"<a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/udalumni/13782794253/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Alumni Event at The Under Armour Headqua</a>" (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nd/2.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY-ND 2.0</a>) by <a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/udalumni/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">University of Delaware Alumni Relations</a>
</div></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Kevin Plank founded Under Armour in his grandma's basement in '96, but yesterday, he said he’ll be <a href="https://www.apnews.com/312328dac97140eaa27e00afc7171c01?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stepping down</a> as CEO of the sportswear company. With $5.2 billion in 2018 sales, it’s certainly come a long way from employees foregoing paychecks to buy ads on ESPN. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But the last few years have been hard</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Stiff competition from Nike, Adidas, and Lululemon accompanied by losses and layoffs. Share prices since 2016 look like our jogging speed when we hit a hill...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1571773398.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><sup class="sub-text">Google</sup></em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Under Armour's particularly <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/07/30/under-armour-q2-2019-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">struggled</a> to grow in North America. Plank's acknowledged customers "have a hard time getting their arms around where Under Armour truly wants to be." </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What's he got mind? "The human performance company...we want to stand for all things innovation." You know...</span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/16/virgin-galactic-armour-release-space-clothing?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">like spacesuits</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Plank hasn’t been perfect. </strong>There was the 2018 #MeToo <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/under-armours-metoo-moment-no-more-strip-clubs-on-company-dime-1541450209?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reckoning</a>. And his Port Covington development <a href="https://www.propublica.org/article/trump-inc-podcast-one-trump-tax-cut-meant-to-help-the-poor-a-billionaire-ended-up-winning-big?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">profited</a> from tax cuts intended to help Baltimore's poor areas. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Plank has until Jan. 1 to get COO Patrik Frisk ready for the big role.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F10%2F22%2Fkevin-plank-will-step-ceo-armour" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Under+Armour%27s+particularly+struggled+to+grow+in+North+America&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/kevin-plank-will-step-ceo-armour&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
APPAREL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/22/nike?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Nike Couldn’t Give Under Armour Just This One
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNzc4NjQ0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Nike</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two coffee breaks after Plank’s announcement, Nike said CEO Mark Parker is <em>also</em> stepping down come January. It's just a matter of time before the apparel execs become roomies in a Hilton Head condo. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Parker took over as boss from Nike founder Phil Knight in <span>ʼ06</span>. He’ll remain executive chairman as John Donahoe, head of enterprise cloud company ServiceNow and former head of eBay, steps into the CEO and president roles. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Not sure we called this one. </strong></span><span>Last year, during a leadership shuffle that saw two of Parker’s potential successors depart, the CEO </span><span><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/press-release/nike-inc-announces-that-mark-parker-will-continue-as-chairman-president-and-ceo-beyond-2020-2018-03-15?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> he was “committed to stay in my role...beyond 2020.” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nike’s been on a tech buying spree for the last two years, and it’s tapping Donahoe (a five-year board member) for his digital transformation expertise.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Parker’s helmed Nike through bumpy times,</strong> including controversy around <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/22/business/nike-ceo-mark-parker.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">treatment</a> of athletes who became pregnant, a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/10/11/nike-shuts-running-project-following-doping-scandal?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doping scandal</a>, and Colin Kaepernick ads. Still, Nike shares are <a href="https://www.barrons.com/articles/nike-ceo-mark-parker-to-step-down-and-be-replaced-by-john-donahoe-of-servicenow-51571778067?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up</a> 29% this year and it’s shrugged off the trade war.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcxNzc1OTc3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you were to take a dozen hot business trends, mix in a dash of celebrity, and drizzle with smart home technology, you'd get Food Network Kitchen, a direct-to-consumer streaming service Discovery, Inc. \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/discoverys-food-network-kitchen-subscription-service-launches-in-u-s-with-live-cooking-classes-1203378710/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e in the U.S. yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut calling this a streaming service is like calling the iPhone a calculator. Food Network Kitchen offers subscribers a library of old cooking shows (like \u003cem\u003eBarefoot Contessa\u003c/em\u003e), recipe guides/videos—and food delivery is on the way. But there's a star of the show...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe Peloton for cooking\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFood Network Kitchen features live and on-demand cooking classes taught by celebrity chefs like Guy Fieri, Bobby Flay, and Martha Stewart. It's \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/discovery-and-amazon-serve-up-new-cooking-app-11569423600?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emodeled\u003c/a\u003e after Peloton's popular spin classes, with one crucial difference: You can alert the instructor before you throw up. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eViewers will be able to comment on chefs' questionable uses of papaya through the show's interactive format.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe service will offer 25 live classes per week plus thousands of other instructional videos.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBig picture\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFood Network Kitchen offers a \u003ca href=\"https://digiday.com/media/discovery-will-use-food-network-kitchen-generate-commerce-revenue-old-tv-shows/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewindow\u003c/a\u003e into how legacy cable companies are aiming to stay alive as Big Tech, Big Telecom, and Big Mouse invade the video streaming space. Here's Discovery's playbook... \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGet niche: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAfter launching this cooking vertical, Discovery also plans to establish streaming services for natural history programming and home improvement (the latter led by Chip and Joanna Gaines). \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDiversify revenue: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFood Network Kitchen will make money through advertising, subscriptions, and affiliate commerce. An ideal customer journey goes something like: \"watch show → be intrigued by recipe → buy ingredients → become loyal paying subscriber.\" \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLeverage technology: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDiscovery has inked a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/10/22/food-network-kitchen-brings-live-interactive-cooking-classes-to-echo-show-fire-tv-more/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epartnership with Amazon\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to integrate the service with Patients\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2019, we repurpose plastic, cans, clothes—and Alzheimer's drugs. Yesterday, Biogen shocked the medical community by \u003ca href=\"http://investors.biogen.com/news-releases/news-release-details/biogen-plans-regulatory-filing-aducanumab-alzheimers-disease?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannouncing\u003c/a\u003e it’s bringing back aducanumab, an Alzheimer’s drug it shelved earlier this year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e Current treatments for Alzheimer's, the most common cause of dementia, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/d8b2c2fa679d40ae97837ec7840e6a64?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonly ease\u003c/a\u003e symptoms temporarily. They don't slow memory loss or deterioration of thinking skills. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn one of Biogen's studies, patients given a high dose of aducanumab showed 23% less decline on one measure of cognitive ability compared with patients given a placebo. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe reversal: \u003c/strong\u003eIn March, a \"futility analysis\" \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/c48e12b2-f4bc-11e9-a79c-bc9acae3b654?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeemed\u003c/a\u003e the drug a no-go. But Biogen looked at some new data with fresh eyes and determined it's ready for action. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis could be as big a medical game-changer as Alexander Fleming's moldy petri dishes. Alzheimer's affects about 5.7 million people in the U.S. and about 50 million globally. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe announcement was definitely a year-changer for Biogen shares. They \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/22/biogen-soars-40percent-on-hopes-of-alzheimers-treatment-approval.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eerased\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a 25% year-to-date drop in just one day. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eBiogen said it will file for FDA approval in early 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\"
